title: Tremonti & Kennedy: How We Experimented With Odd Guitar Tunings On New Alter Bridge Album [News]
text: UG News editor since early 2013. King Crimson fan. I handle the news around here. Posted a day ago 8 Mark Tremonti and Myles Kennedy recently discussed their approach to guitar tuning on the latest Alter Bridge record " The Last Hero ," explaining how they spiced it up a bit in this department.Myles tells Guitar World : "We definitely experimented a bit. For instance, if Mark was playing something that seemed to have a tonal center of G, I might tune to open G, which is not something I normally do."Tremonti chimed in: "We definitely used a lot of tunings we have never used before - some pretty standard, like D-A-D-G-A-D, and others more out there, like B-F#-C#-F#-B-D. And I even used a seven-string for the first time - on the title track . It has been sitting around my house, and I challenged myself to make good use of it."During the rest of the chat, the boys admitted just how different their playing style is, with Myles explaining: "I tend to play with a light touch, and that's not necessarily the best way to play hard rock or heavy metal. But the way Mark attacks the strings has really rubbed off on me and now it feels natural to really dig in."As you may or may not remember, Mr. Tremonti previously singled out open D5 tuning (D-A-D-A-D-D) as his personal favorite, saying it's impossible to make anything sound bad in it.Some of Mr. Tremonti's tracks that utilize open D5 or its half-step-down version include "Are You Ready?", "Faceless Man," "My Sacrifice," "Fortress," "Ghost of Days Gone By," and "Open Your Eyes."
